description: The Citrix Bleed vulnerability (CVE-2023-4966) in the Citrix NetScaler Application Delivery Controller allows unauthenticated remote attackers to exploit the system easily. This vulnerability facilitates the retrieval of valid session tokens, leading to potential authentication bypass. As such, attackers can gain unauthorized access and exploit valid user sessions. The critical nature of this vulnerability necessitates immediate remediation, including patching affected systems. Organizations are encouraged to implement the provided patches and conduct thorough scans to identify and mitigate exposure to this vulnerability.
